articles.headline: For Europe’s Economy, a Lost Decade Looms
articles.snippet: With the exception of Germany, none of Europe’s biggest economies have returned to the level of economic output they had at the beginning of 2008.
articles.abstract: With the exception of Germany, none of Europe’s biggest economies have returned to the level of economic output they had at the beginning of 2008.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The euro zone is hurtling back into recession, economists declared after official figures this week portrayed a shrinking economy. But by some measures the downturn has been under way for years.

articles.headline: For Buckyballs Toys, Child Safety Is a Growing Issue
articles.snippet: Regulators are cracking down on products like Buckyballs, saying they are too attractive and hazardous to young consumers.
articles.abstract: Regulators are cracking down on products like Buckyballs, saying they are too attractive and hazardous to young consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Three years ago, two pals from Brooklyn came up with the idea of creating a desktop toy out of powerful magnets. Their creation, Buckyballs, became an instant hit. And by this year, the two — Craig Zucker and Jake Bronstein — had expected annual sales to reach about $25 million.

articles.headline: Schools Pass Debt to the Next Generation
articles.snippet: Districts stymied by residents’ opposition to new taxes are finding creative ways to meet their responsibilities — often at extremely high costs.
articles.abstract: Districts stymied by residents’ opposition to new taxes are finding creative ways to meet their responsibilities — often at extremely high costs.
articles.lead_paragraph: The deleveraging of America is well under way, as individuals and companies recover from the excess borrowing that helped to produce the boom and left many people vulnerable when the bust arrived. Household debt is down nearly $900 billion over the last four years, partly from repayments and partly from defaults.

articles.headline: In Drought, a Debate Over Quota for Ethanol
articles.snippet: The corn farming, meat production and biofuel industries are sparring over the Agriculture Department’s ethanol quota as a drought ravages corn crops.
articles.abstract: The corn farming, meat production and biofuel industries are sparring over the Agriculture Department’s ethanol quota as a drought ravages corn crops.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Three big intertwined but rival agribusinesses — corn farmers, meat and poultry producers, and biofuel refineries — are in a political fight to protect their interests as a drought ravages corn producers and industrial consumers alike.

articles.headline: Pursuing Soft Power, China Puts Stamp on Africa’s News
articles.snippet: China’s state-run news media are rapidly growing in Africa, hoping to bolster Beijing’s influence in a region rich in the resources needed to fuel China’s powerhouse industries.
articles.abstract: China’s state-run news media are rapidly growing in Africa, hoping to bolster Beijing’s influence in a region rich in the resources needed to fuel China’s powerhouse industries.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — China’s investment prowess and construction know-how is widely on display in this long-congested African capital. A $200 million ring road is being built and partly financed by Beijing. The international airport is undergoing a $208 million expansion supported by the Chinese, whose loans also paid for a working-class housing complex that residents have nicknamed the Great Wall apartments.

articles.headline: Restoration Hardware Co-Chief Steps Down After an Inquiry
articles.snippet: Gary Friedman was confronted by the company’s board over an inappropriate personal relationship, according to people familiar with the matter.
articles.abstract: Gary Friedman was confronted by the company’s board over an inappropriate personal relationship, according to people familiar with the matter.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gary Friedman, the chairman and co-chief executive of Restoration Hardware, has stepped down from his positions after an internal inquiry into an intimate relationship he had with a 26-year-old female employee, according to people involved in the matter.

articles.headline: Romney Says He Paid at Least 13% in Income Taxes
articles.snippet: Calling interest in his taxes “small-minded,” Mitt Romney said he had looked at 10 years of returns, a response to Democrats who suggested he might have paid nothing in some years.
articles.abstract: Calling interest in his taxes “small-minded,” Mitt Romney said he had looked at 10 years of returns, a response to Democrats who suggested he might have paid nothing in some years.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Mitt Romney said Thursday that he paid at least 13 percent of his income in taxes each year during the past decade, again confronting a vexing issue that Democrats have used to portray him as out of touch with middle-class values.

articles.headline: U.S. Reliance on Oil From Saudi Arabia Is Growing Again
articles.snippet: Imports of oil from the kingdom have grown by more than 20 percent this year, leaving the United States vulnerable to tensions in the Persian Gulf.
articles.abstract: Imports of oil from the kingdom have grown by more than 20 percent this year, leaving the United States vulnerable to tensions in the Persian Gulf.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The United States is increasing its dependence on oil from Saudi Arabia, raising its imports from the kingdom by more than 20 percent this year, even as fears of military conflict in the tinderbox Persian Gulf region grow.

articles.headline: Long-Term Jobless Regroup to Fight the Odds
articles.snippet: Gatherings of a group of California professionals in the depths of unemployment reveal a post-recession landscape where grim frustration battles with the simple desire to find a way out.
articles.abstract: Gatherings of a group of California professionals in the depths of unemployment reveal a post-recession landscape where grim frustration battles with the simple desire to find a way out.
articles.lead_paragraph: CORONA, Calif. — The analysts pore over the numbers every month, the full menagerie of economic indicators. President Obama and Mitt Romney trade barbs over who is at fault for a sluggish recovery. But here, in a region with one of the highest unemployment rates in the country, other numbers often loom larger.

articles.headline: In Paper, Chief of Egypt’s Army Criticized U.S.
articles.snippet: Gen. Sedky Sobhi argued that America’s presence in the Middle East and its “one sided” support of Israel had mired it in an unwinnable war with Islamist militants.
articles.abstract: Gen. Sedky Sobhi argued that America’s presence in the Middle East and its “one sided” support of Israel had mired it in an unwinnable war with Islamist militants.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a student at the United States Army War College in Pennsylvania, the chief of staff of Egypt’s armed forces argued in a paper that the American military presence in the Middle East and its “one sided” support of Israel were fueling hatred toward the United States and miring it in an unwinnable global war with Islamist militants.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick and Kareem Fahim

articles.headline: Anti-Putin Stunt Earns Punk Band Two Years in Jail
articles.snippet: Three women who staged a protest against Vladimir V. Putin, Russia’s president, in a cathedral and became a cause célèbre of artists around the world were convicted of hooliganism.
articles.abstract: Three women who staged a protest against Vladimir V. Putin, Russia’s president, in a cathedral and became a cause célèbre of artists around the world were convicted of hooliganism.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Three young women who staged an anti-Putin stunt in Moscow’s main Orthodox cathedral, and whose jailing became a cause célèbre championed by artists around the world, were convicted of hooliganism on Friday and sentenced to two years in a penal colony.

articles.headline: In the Calm of Summer, Stocks Climb Gingerly
articles.snippet: A slow summer rally has lifted shares, but many investors are waiting for the next jarring event out of Europe or a disappointing report on the United States economy.
articles.abstract: A slow summer rally has lifted shares, but many investors are waiting for the next jarring event out of Europe or a disappointing report on the United States economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks approached their highest levels of the year on Friday in the wake of some mildly encouraging economic data, closing out their sixth-straight positive week.

articles.headline: When the Network Effect Goes Into Reverse
articles.snippet: The more users a social network site like Facebook attracts, the more others will want to use it. But a site’s audience can decline just as quickly as it grows.
articles.abstract: The more users a social network site like Facebook attracts, the more others will want to use it. But a site’s audience can decline just as quickly as it grows.
articles.lead_paragraph: With battered Facebook shares closing Friday at just over half their offering price in May, no one’s talking anymore about a social media “bubble.”
